column1: #Text=Polycrystalline samples of Nd2(1−x)Zr2(1+x)O7 (x = 0.2, 0.05, 0 and –0.1) were synthesized using solid state methods.

#Text=Stoichiometric amounts of dried (900 ◦C, 12 hours) Nd2O3 (Afla Aesar, 99.99%) and ZrO2 (Alfa Aesar, 99.98%) were ground together in an agate mortar and pestle and pressed into pellets at 310 MPa in a cold isostatic press.
#Text=The pellets were then reacted in air in Al2O3 crucibles for 60 hours each at 1300, 1375 and 1450 ◦C with re-grinding and re-pressing between reactions.
#Text=Platinum was always placed between the sample and Al2O3 crucible to prevent possible reaction at high temperatures.
#Text=Powder X-ray diffraction (XRD) using a Panalytical Emperyan diffractometer was employed to evaluate the final product.
#Text=All Rietveld refinements were performed using the TOPAS software package [39].
#Text=In preparation for crystal growth, the x = 0 powder was packed into clean rubber balloons and pressed into rods (diameter ≈ 4 mm, length ≈ 80 – 100 mm) at 310 MPa in a cold isostatic press.
#Text=The rods were sintered at 1450 ◦C for 24 – 48 hours, in air, on sacrificial beds of x = 0 powder.
